procedure.title: cylinder head testing tools : use
Cylinder head test:

ul.li: It is essential to put metal protectors1on the blanking plugs2. The metal protectors are specific to each cylinder head model. Each protector is fitted with a bracket for mounting it on the cylinder head (the engine type is engraved on each protector).
There should be nobody behind or beside the tank during the test.
The operator should wear the protective equipment provided.
The operator should submerge the cylinder head using the straps provided.
Before pressurising the cylinder head, it is essential that the operator positions the screen3(as shown in the illustration).

Before moving the transparent screen from its safety position, and before manoeuvring the cylinder head in the tank (change of position, removal from the tank at the end of the test), reduce the air pressure using the depressurising button on the pressure gauge.

procedure.title: PRESENTATION OF THE EQUIPMENT

ul.li: a transparent visor,
a pair of gloves,
an apron.

procedure.title: PRESENTATION OF THE CYLINDER HEAD TEST TANK

stentry.para: An air pressure limiter set at 6 to 7 bars (preadjusted before delivery) is installed on the test tank.
Inflation pressure gauge, connected to the pressure limiter output.
Thermostat to regulate the water temperature, which should be set at between 70 and 80˚C maximum (preadjusted before delivery of the tank).
Transparent protection screen, which should be in place before each air pressurisation in the cylinder head. A safety locking position.
A gasket, and a spanner for removing the elements.

procstep.para: The notch16on the element protection grill indicates the minimum water level to be maintained in the tank, and also serves as a handle to pull the protective grill away from the elements (in order to clean it, for example).

noteR.para: With the cylinder head submerged, the water level should be about 10 mm above the cylinder head.

procedure.title: POSITIONING THE CYLINDER HEAD TEST TANK

procstep.para: Choose an area with good lighting so as to have a clear view of any air bubbles that will form if the cylinder head is defective.
Install the tank at a minimum of 1 metre from a wall and have a source of cold water close by.

procedure.title: CONNECTING THE CYLINDER HEAD TEST TANK TO THE ELECTRICITY SUPPLY

procstep.para: Connection should be carried out by an approved electrician. It is essential to install a differential circuit breaker. Check the effectiveness of the earth connection.
It is preferable that the supply cable going into the tank should be mechanically protected inside a sheath or tube.
This cable should not hinder the operator's movements.

If the indicator light bulb needs replacing, unscrew the green indicator light by hand, remove the white contact pad by pulling towards you and change the bulb (bayonet fixing). Refit the white pad in its position to ensure that the rubber seal is effective.

figure.title: Connection diagram for the electrical connection box

stentry.para: 220 V indicator lamp, voltage indicator for the elements (this lamp goes out when the temperature displayed on the thermostat is reached)

procstep.para: Figures corresponding to the marks on the switch (D) and on the three phase relay (E).

procedure.title: CYLINDER HEAD TEST PROCEDURE

procstep.para: Practical advice before installing kits on the cylinder heads:

ul.li: Before putting in place the cylinder head sealing plate, remove all dirt from the old gasket so that the elastomer gasket is in contact with a clean surface.
Dismantle the valves and clean the cylinder head to remove all traces of oil.
The tightening order of the sealing plate should be identical to that for tightening the cylinder head. Torque tighten the bolts (15 to 25 N.m).
On some cylinder heads, the mounting holes for the inlet and exhaust manifold studs are in the water chambers (leave them in place).
the camshaft,
the valves,
the injectors ,
the pre/postheating plugs,
the coolant temperature sensors.

blanking plug2∅10 mm,
the sealing plate3with the reference JP 10104A ,
blanking plug4∅9 mm.

procstep.para: Check that there is a stud present5.
Remove the end piece or the mounting for the thermostatic sensor and replace it with the plug6(the ∅13 mm thread pitch is 1/4 gas).
Use the test tool7with the reference J8S .

ul.li: the sealing plate41with the reference L7X A L,
the test tool42with the reference V6 24S PCR.

procedure.title: CYLINDER HEAD TEST

procstep.para: The water in the tank should be at a temperature of about 80˚C.
Before placing the cylinder head in the tank, the operator should ALWAYS put on the personal safety clothes and equipment.
Lift the transparent protection screenAand swing it to the right.
Lower the cylinder head into the tank using the straps provided.
With the cylinder head submerged, check that the water level in the tank is about 10 mm above the top of the cylinder head.
Before pressurising the cylinder head, put the transparent protection screenAin its locking position.
Move the sliding plateBto about 50 mm from the edge of the tank.
Gradually bring the cylinder head under pressure (between 5 and 7 Bar).
Leave the cylinder head under pressure for approximately 10 minutes . If bubbles appear, the cylinder head contains cracks.
Reduce the air pressure using a pressure gauge.
Remove the transparent safety screen from its notches.
Leave it to cool by placing it on the sliding plate.

noteR.para: Once the kit is dismantled from the cylinder head, spray the screws, the plugs, between the elastomer gaskets and the lubricating plates without silicone.
